page.title: 05WADDINGTON COUNCIL PLANS
page.content: The Parish Council is running a summer playscheme for 4 weeks during August for children aged 5_11 years. About 100 children a day attend. The Council's main concern at present is to keep the village viable, with a balanced population of all ages.It considers there are enough old peoples council dwellings in the village and has been pressing for development to attract younger people. In this it has been successful with a small estate in Blacks Close,and a further bungalow development now in the planning stage at Sycamore Farm. A new village appraisal is being prepared with the District Council. The Council owns 21 acres of playing fields but this is administered by the Waddington Playing Fields Association with financial backing from the Council.
